class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Are you ready to join a community leading in innovative teaching and learning? Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nLocation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nJob Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nResponsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><br>\n1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br>\n2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br>\n3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br>\n4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br>\n5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br>\n6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the university&iquest;s research framework.<br>\n7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.<\u002Fp><br>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nRequired Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>Educational Requirements<\u002Fb><br>\nMasters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br>\n<br>\n<b>Required Experience<\u002Fb><br>\nFive (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nPreferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><br>\nBilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br>\nExpertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br>\nProficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br>\nExperience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.<br>\n<br>\n<b>Preferred Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb><br>\nPh.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nProposed Salary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.<\u002Fp><p>\nComprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nKnowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>ABILITIES<\u002Fb><br>\nAble to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br>\nAbility to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br>\nAbility to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br>\nAbility to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br>\nCapacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br>\nAbility to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br>\nCapacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br>\nAbility to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br>\nCapacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br>\n<br>\n<b>KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><br>\nKnowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br>\n<br>\n<b>SKILLS<\u002Fb><br>\nProficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br>\nProficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br>\nProficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br>\nExcellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br>\nProficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br>\nProficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination.\n<br>\nStrong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br>\nStrong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nUSG Core Values<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection8\u002FC224\u002F#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.<\u002Fp><p>\nAdditionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection6\u002FC2653.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nEqual Employment Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Kennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br>\n<br>\nFor additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nOther Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>This is not a supervisory position.<br>\nThis position has financial responsibilities.<br>\nThis position will not be required to drive.<br>\nThis role is considered a position of trust.<br>\nThis position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br>\nThis position may travel 1% - 24% of the time<br>\nThis position does not require security clearance.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nBackground Check<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n<div>\n<div><\u002Fdiv><div><ul><li>Credit Report<\u002Fli><li>\nStandard Enhanced<\u002Fli><li>\nEducation<\u002Fli><\u002Ful><p>\nPer the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Final candidates may be asked to disclose criminal record history during the initial screening process and prior to a conditional offer of employment. Applicants for positions of trust with screening<br>\nresults which confirm a disqualifying criminal history will be immediately disqualified from employment eligibility.<\u002Fp><p>\nAll applicants are required to include professional references as part of their application process. Some positions may require additional job-based screenings such as motor vehicle report, credit check, pre-employment drug screening and\u002For verification of academic credentials.<\u002Fp><p>\nhttps:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fhr\u002Fassets\u002Fhr\u002Fhrap_manual\u002FHRAP_Background_Investigation_Employment.pdf<\u002Fp><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv>","text":"About Us\n\nAre you ready to join a community leading in innovative teaching and learning? Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.\n\nLocation\n\nOur Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.\n\nJob Summary\n\nThe AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.\n\nResponsibilities\n\nKEY RESPONSIBILITIES:\n1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.\n2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.\n3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.\n4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.\n5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.\n6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the universitys research framework.\n7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.\n\nRequired Qualifications\n\nEducational Requirements\nMasters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields\n\nRequired Experience\nFive (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting\n\nPreferred Qualifications\n\nAdditional Preferred Qualifications\nBilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.\nExpertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.\nProficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)\nExperience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.\n\nPreferred Educational Qualifications\nPh.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields\n\nProposed Salary\n\nThe budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.\n\nComprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.\n\nKnowledge, Skills, & Abilities\n\nABILITIES\nAble to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.\nAbility to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.\nAbility to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.\nAbility to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.\nCapacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.\nAbility to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.\nCapacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.\nAbility to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.\nCapacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.\n\nKNOWLEDGE\nKnowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.\n\nSKILLS\nProficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.\nProficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges\nProficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.\nExcellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.\nProficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)\nProficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination.\nStrong attention to detail and follow-up skills\nStrong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette\n\nUSG Core Values\n\nThe University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection8\u002FC224\u002F#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.\n\nAdditionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection6\u002FC2653.\n\nEqual Employment Opportunity\n\nKennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.\n\nFor additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu\n\nOther Information\n\nThis is not a supervisory position.\nThis position has financial responsibilities.\nThis position will not be required to drive.\nThis role is considered a position of trust.\nThis position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).\nThis position may travel 1% - 24% of the time\nThis position does not require security clearance.\n\nBackground Check\n\nCredit Report\nStandard Enhanced\nEducation\n\nPer the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><br> 1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br> 2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br> 3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br> 4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br> 5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br> 6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the universitys research framework.<br> 7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Educational Requirements<\u002Fb><br> Masters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br> <br> <b>Required Experience<\u002Fb><br> Five (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Bilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br> Expertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br> Proficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br> Experience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.<br> <br> <b>Preferred Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Proposed Salary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> Comprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Knowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>ABILITIES<\u002Fb><br> Able to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br> Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br> Ability to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br> Ability to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br> Capacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br> Ability to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br> Capacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br> Ability to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br> Capacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br> <br> <b>KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><br> Knowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br> <br> <b>SKILLS<\u002Fb><br> Proficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br> Proficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br> Proficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br> Excellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br> Proficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br> Proficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination. <br> Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br> Strong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> USG Core Values<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection8\u002FC224\u002F#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> Additionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection6\u002FC2653.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Employment Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>Kennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br> <br> For additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Other Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>This is not a supervisory position.<br> This position has financial responsibilities.<br> This position will not be required to drive.<br> This role is considered a position of trust.<br> This position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br> This position may travel 1% - 24% of the time<br> This position does not require security clearance.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Background Check<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n   <div> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Credit Report<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Standard Enhanced<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Education<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p> Per the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Final candidates may be asked to disclose criminal record history during the initial screening process and prior to a conditional offer of employment. Applicants for positions of trust with screening<br> results which confirm a disqualifying criminal history will be immediately disqualified from employment eligibility.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> All applicants are required to include professional references as part of their application process. Some positions may require additional job-based screenings such as motor vehicle report, credit check, pre-employment drug screening and\u002For verification of academic credentials.<\u002Fp>\n Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><br> 1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br> 2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br> 3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br> 4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br> 5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br> 6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the universitys research framework.<br> 7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Educational Requirements<\u002Fb><br> Masters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br> <br> <b>Required Experience<\u002Fb><br> Five (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Bilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br> Expertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br> Proficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br> Experience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.<br> <br> <b>Preferred Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Proposed Salary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> Comprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Knowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>ABILITIES<\u002Fb><br> Able to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br> Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br> Ability to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br> Ability to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br> Capacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br> Ability to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br> Capacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br> Ability to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br> Capacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br> <br> <b>KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><br> Knowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br> <br> <b>SKILLS<\u002Fb><br> Proficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br> Proficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br> Proficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br> Excellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br> Proficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br> Proficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination. <br> Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br> as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br> <br> For additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Other Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>This is not a supervisory position.<br> This position has financial responsibilities.<br> This position will not be required to drive.<br> This role is considered a position of trust.<br> This position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br> This position may travel 1% - Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><br> 1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br> 2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br> 3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br> 4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br> 5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br> 6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the universitys research framework.<br> 7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Educational Requirements<\u002Fb><br> Masters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br> <br> <b>Required Experience<\u002Fb><br> Five (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Bilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br> Expertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br> Proficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br> Experience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.<br> <br> <b>Preferred Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Proposed Salary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> Comprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Knowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p><b>ABILITIES<\u002Fb><br> Able to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br> Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br> Ability to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br> Ability to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br> Capacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br> Ability to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br> Capacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br> Ability to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br> Capacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br> <br> <b>KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><br> Knowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br> <br> <b>SKILLS<\u002Fb><br> Proficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br> Proficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br> Proficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br> Excellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br> Proficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br> Proficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination. <br> Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br> Strong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> USG Core Values<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection8\u002FC224\u002F#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> Additionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection6\u002FC2653.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Employment Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>Kennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br> <br> For additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Other Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <p>This is not a supervisory position.<br> This position has financial responsibilities.<br> This position will not be required to drive.<br> This role is considered a position of trust.<br> This position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br> This position may travel 1% - 24% of the time<br> This position does not require security clearance.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Background Check<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n   <div> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Credit Report<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Standard Enhanced<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Education<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p> Per the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Final candidates may be asked to disclose criminal record history during the initial screening process and prior to a conditional offer of employment. Applicants for positions of trust with screening<br> results which confirm a disqualifying criminal history will be immediately disqualified from employment eligibility.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> All applicants are required to include professional references as part of their application process. Some positions may require additional job-based screenings such as motor vehicle report, credit check, pre-employment drug screening and\u002For verification of academic credentials.<\u002Fp>\n     <p> https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fhr\u002Fassets\u002Fhr\u002Fhrap_manual\u002FHRAP_Background_Investigation_Employment.pdf<\u002Fp>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n<\u002Fdiv>","screenerRequirementsModel":null,"showExpiredHeader":false,"tagModels":null,"viewJobDisplay":"DESKTOP_EMBEDDED"},"sectionedJobInfoModel":null},"mobtk":"1i3ejbu18jjin801","profileBaseUrl":"https:\u002F\u002Fprofile.indeed.com","rtl":false,"salaryInfoModel":{"disclaimerIcon":null,"featureTokens":[],"indeedEstimateText":null,"matchingSalary":false,"minimumPayPreferencePresent":false,"salaryCurrency":"USD","salaryEstimationDisclaimer":null,"salaryLabel":{"scope":null,"usefulPercent":null},"salaryMax":145900.0,"salaryMin":127940.0,"salarySource":"EXTRACTION","salaryText":"$127,940 - $145,900 a year","salaryTextFormatted":false,"salaryType":"YEARLY","userMinimumPayAmount":null,"userMinimumPaySalaryType":null}},"jobDescription":"<div><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Are you ready to join a community leading in innovative teaching and learning? Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nLocation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nJob Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nResponsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><br>\n1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br>\n2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br>\n3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br>\n4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br>\n5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br>\n6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the university&iquest;s research framework.<br>\n7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.<\u002Fp><br>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nRequired Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>Educational Requirements<\u002Fb><br>\nMasters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br>\n<br>\n<b>Required Experience<\u002Fb><br>\nFive (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nPreferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><br>\nBilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br>\nExpertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br>\nProficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br>\nExperience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR\u002FVAD\u002FDiarization applications with Whisper models.<br>\n<br>\n<b>Preferred Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb><br>\nPh.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nProposed Salary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.<\u002Fp><p>\nComprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu\u002Fbenefits.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nKnowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p><b>ABILITIES<\u002Fb><br>\nAble to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br>\nAbility to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br>\nAbility to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br>\nAbility to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br>\nCapacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br>\nAbility to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br>\nCapacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br>\nAbility to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br>\nCapacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br>\n<br>\n<b>KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><br>\nKnowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br>\n<br>\n<b>SKILLS<\u002Fb><br>\nProficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br>\nProficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br>\nProficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br>\nExcellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br>\nProficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br>\nProficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination.\n<br>\nStrong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br>\nStrong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nUSG Core Values<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection8\u002FC224\u002F#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.<\u002Fp><p>\nAdditionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fpolicymanual\u002Fsection6\u002FC2653.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nEqual Employment Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>Kennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br>\n<br>\nFor additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nOther Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><div><br>\n<div><div>\n<\u002Fdiv><p>This is not a supervisory position.<br>\nThis position has financial responsibilities.<br>\nThis position will not be required to drive.<br>\nThis role is considered a position of trust.<br>\nThis position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br>\nThis position may travel 1% - 24% of the time<br>\nThis position does not require security clearance.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><div><div><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>\nBackground Check<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n<div>\n<div><\u002Fdiv><div><ul><li>Credit Report<\u002Fli><li>\nStandard Enhanced<\u002Fli><li>\nEducation<\u002Fli><\u002Ful><p>\nPer the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Final candidates may be asked to disclose criminal record history during the initial screening process and prior to a conditional offer of employment. credentials.<\u002Fp><p>\nhttps:\u002F\u002Fwww.usg.edu\u002Fhr\u002Fassets\u002Fhr\u002Fhrap_manual\u002FHRAP_Background_Investigation_Employment.pdf<\u002Fp><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv><\u002Fdiv>","isJobClickSponsored":false}},"pageId":"viewjob","userAgent":"Mozilla\u002F5.0 esbq1260"><span>&amp;nbsp;</span></span></div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="mosaic-aboveFullJobDescription" class="mosaic mosaic-empty-zone"></div><div id="mosaic-aboveExtractedJobDescription" class="mosaic mosaic-empty-zone"></div><div id="jobLocationSectionWrapper" class="css-1iyxsfc eu4oa1w0"><h2 id="jobLocationSectionTitle" class="css-1yytfzy e1tiznh50">Location</h2><div id="jobLocationWrapper" class="css-1u9px01 e37uo190"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" focusable="false" role="img" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true" id="jobLocationIcon" class="css-r72e78 eac13zx0"><path d="M12 2C8.13 2 5 5.13 5 9c0 4.523 5.195 11.093 6.634 12.826a.47.47 0 00.732 0C13.805 20.093 19 13.523 19 Chastain Rd NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144</div></div></div><div role="separator" aria-orientation="horizontal" class="css-92hmla e15p7aqh1"><span class="css-1b6omqv esbq1260"><span>&amp;nbsp;</span></span></div></div><div id="benefits" data-testid="benefits-test" class="css-eynugf eu4oa1w0"><h2 id="benefitsSectionTitle" class="css-gfuqm7 e1tiznh50">Benefits<div class="css-1opnqdm e1wnkr790">Pulled from the full job description</div></h2><div class="css-1oelwk6 eu4oa1w0"><div class="css-k3ey05 eu4oa1w0"><span class="css-c62ar3 e1wnkr790"><ul class="css-8tnble eu4oa1w0"><li class="css-kyg8or eu4oa1w0">Health insurance</li><li class="css-kyg8or eu4oa1w0">Retirement plan</li><li class="css-kyg8or eu4oa1w0">Vision insurance</li></ul></span></div></div><div role="separator" aria-orientation="horizontal" class="css-vms2hq e15p7aqh1"><span class="css-1b6omqv esbq1260"><span>&amp;nbsp;</span></span></div></div><div id="jobDescriptionTitle"><h2 tabindex="-1" id="jobDescriptionTitleHeading" class="css-wpzt8u e1tiznh50">Full job description</h2></div><div id="jobDescriptionText" class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description css-16y4thd eu4oa1w0"><div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>About Us</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>Are you ready to join a community leading in innovative teaching and learning? Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgias colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our universitys vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. Come to KSU and find your passion.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Location</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>Our Kennesaw campus is located at 1000 Chastain Road NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Job Summary</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>The AI Strategist and Applied Researcher will lead the integration and implementation of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies across our research operations. This crucial role focuses on enhancing our AI-driven platforms and tools, enabling faculty to secure and manage grants more effectively. The AI Strategist will drive innovation, streamline research processes, and substantially boost the universitys competitive edge in the academic and research fields by leveraging advanced AI solutions.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Responsibilities</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p><b>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</b><br> 1. Designs and implements advanced AI solutions to optimize research operations and streamline grant management processes, ensuring both efficiency and effectiveness.<br> 2. Analyzes successful grant applications in-depth to identify patterns and develop a customized alert system for faculty, thereby enhancing their funding success rates.<br> 3. Enhances the usability and efficiency of accessing grant-related information, particularly on platforms such as grants.gov, by updating and improving current systems and processes.<br> 4. Collaborates with web developers to build a comprehensive platform that tracks and supports researcher activities, promoting a more integrated research environment.<br> 5. Provides strategic leadership and support to faculty and staff, encouraging the adoption of AI in research practices.<br> 6. Continuously monitors advancements in AI to ensure their strategic and practical integration within the universitys research framework.<br> 7. Partners with industry leaders and academic institutions to advance AI research initiatives and secure additional funding opportunities.</p>
     <br> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Required Qualifications</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p><b>Educational Requirements</b><br> Masters degree in Natural Language Processing, linguistics, or related fields<br> <br> <b>Required Experience</b><br> Five (5) years of work experience at a research university or similar academic setting</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Preferred Qualifications</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p><b>Additional Preferred Qualifications</b><br> Bilingual in English and another language used prominently in the AI space.<br> Expertise in advanced AI technologies, especially LLMS, transformer architecture, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation.<br> Proficiency in using ML toolkits (e.g. PyTorch, MLX)<br> Experience with language model training, large-scale text generation, finetuning with LoRA, image generation with Stable Diffusion, and ASR/VAD/Diarization applications with Whisper models.<br> <br> <b>Preferred Educational Qualifications</b><br> Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing, or related fields</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Proposed Salary</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>The budgeted salary range is $127,940 to $145,900. Offers are based on relevant experience.</p>
     <p> Comprehensive benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, 13 paid holidays, vacation, generous retirement plans, tuition waiver, wellness options, and much more! Visit hr.kennesaw.edu/benefits.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Knowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p><b>ABILITIES</b><br> Able to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time, meeting assigned deadlines.<br> Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches.<br> Ability to design experiments, conduct trials, and validate hypotheses in AI research.<br> Ability to generate creative ideas and solutions to advance AI capabilities and applications.<br> Capacity to think strategically and anticipate future trends in AI and related fields.<br> Ability to develop and articulate a long-term vision for AI initiatives aligned with organizational goals.<br> Capacity to identify opportunities for leveraging AI to create competitive advantages.<br> Ability to critically evaluate the impact and effectiveness of AI solutions.<br> Capacity to assess risks, benefits, and ethical implications of AI implementations.<br> <br> <b>KNOWLEDGE</b><br> Knowledge of AI ethics, fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation strategies.<br> <br> <b>SKILLS</b><br> Proficiency in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization techniques.<br> Proficiency in designing and implementing innovative AI solutions to address challenges<br> Proficiency in planning, executing, and managing AI projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.<br> Excellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem-solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, and presentation skills.<br> Proficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)<br> Proficiency with scholarship processes across all phases, including but not limited to ideation, literature review, exploration of funding, grant-writing, manuscript preparation, and dissemination. <br> Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills<br> Strong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> USG Core Values</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8.2.18.1.2 and can be found on-line at https://www.usg.edu/policymanual/section8/C224/#p8.2.18_personnel_conduct.</p>
     <p> Additionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on-line at https://www.usg.edu/policymanual/section6/C2653.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Equal Employment Opportunity</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>Kennesaw State University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The University is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work and study. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and University policy, the University prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person because of race, color, sex (including sexual harassment, pregnancy, and medical conditions related to pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity or national origin, religion, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran or military status by any member of the KSU Community on campus, in connection with a University program or activity, or in a manner that creates a hostile environment for members of the KSU community.<br> <br> For additional information on this policy, or to file a complaint under the provisions of this policy, students, employees, applicants for employment or admission or other third parties should contact the Office of Institutional Equity at English Building, Suite 225, eeo@kennesaw.edu</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Other Information</b></h2>
   <div>
    <br> 
    <div>
     <div> 
     </div>
     <p>This is not a supervisory position.<br> This position has financial responsibilities.<br> This position will not be required to drive.<br> This role is considered a position of trust.<br> This position does not require a purchasing card (P-Card).<br> This position may travel 1% - 24% of the time<br> This position does not require security clearance.</p> 
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <div>
  <div>
   <h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b> Background Check</b></h2> 
   <div> 
    <div></div>
    <div>
     <ul>
      <li>Credit Report</li>
      <li> Standard Enhanced</li>
      <li> Education</li>
     </ul>
     <p> Per the University System of Georgia background check policy, all final candidates will be required to consent to a criminal background investigation. Final candidates may be asked to disclose criminal record history during the initial screening process and prior to a conditional offer of employment. Applicants for positions of trust with screening<br> results which confirm a disqualifying criminal history will be immediately disqualified from employment eligibility.</p>
     <p> All applicants are required to include professional references as part of their application process. Some positions may require additional job-based screenings such as motor vehicle report, credit check, pre-employment drug screening and/or verification of academic credentials.</p>
     <p> https://www.usg.edu/hr/assets/hr/hrap_manual/HRAP_Background_Investigation_Employment.pdf</p>
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
